summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding a discovery production in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It includes a Brady disclosure revealing that during the 2005 Palm Beach investigation, a witness (Witness-1) stated Jeffrey Epstein paid her to bring underage girls for sexualized massages and made the statement 'the younger the better.' The witness is represented by attorney Rita Glavin.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the 2005 Palm Beach investigation. The disclosure states a witness claimed he paid for underage girls for sexualized massages and said 'the younger the better.'

persons.name: Witness-1
persons.context: An unnamed witness from the 2005 Palm Beach investigation who disclosed to detectives that Epstein paid her to bring girls, including multiple under the age of eighteen, for sexualized massages.

persons.name: Rita Glavin
persons.context: Identified as the attorney representing Witness-1.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced indirectly as the case subject ('Maxwell's entire index') and the recipient of the discovery production.

connections.description: Epstein paid Witness-1 to bring girls for sexualized massages, according to the witness's 2005 statement.
Rita Glavin is identified as the attorney representing Witness-1.
Implicitly connected as the discovery production is for the Maxwell case and concerns evidence from the investigation of Epstein.

events.title: Palm Beach Police Investigation of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The Palm Beach Department investigated Jeffrey Epstein. During this investigation, Witness-1 disclosed that Epstein paid her to bring girls, including multiple underage girls, for sexualized massages and quoted Epstein saying 'the younger the better.'

events.title: Sixth Discovery Production to Ghislaine Maxwell's Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY finalized and sent a sixth production of discovery materials, including a Brady disclosure letter, to the defense team for Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY)
keyFacts: During the 2005 Palm Beach investigation, a witness (Witness-1) stated Jeffrey Epstein paid her to bring girls for 'sexualized massages.'
Witness-1 quoted Epstein as saying 'the younger the better' and stated she brought multiple girls under the age of eighteen to his Florida residence.
Witness-1 is represented by attorney Rita Glavin.
This information was formally disclosed by the Government to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense in November 2020 as a potential Brady disclosure, made 'in an abundance of caution.'
The document is part of the discovery process in the U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell case in the Southern District of New York.
